Address¶

class AddressBook.Address.Address(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents an entry in the address book.

NOTE: Only numerical postal codes are permitted.

Variables:

  • firstname – The first name of the person.

  • lastname – The last name of the person.

  • street – The street where the person lives.

  • number – The house number of the person.

  • postal_code – The postal code of the person’s address.

  • place – The city where the person lives.

  • birthdate – The birthdate of the person.

  • phone – The phone number of the person.

  • email – The email address of the person.

classmethod get_validate_email(value)[source]¶

Validates the email address using the email_validator library. checks if the email format is valid and if the email is deliverable.

Parameters:

value (Optional[str]) – The email address to validate.

Returns:

The validated email address, or None if the value is empty.

Return type:

Optional[str]

Raises:

ValueError – If the email format is invalid.

classmethod validate_birthdate(value)[source]¶

Validates and converts the birthdate string into a datetime.date object.

Parameters:

value (str) – The birthdate string in ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ format.

Returns:

The birthdate as a datetime.date object if valid, or None if the value is empty.

Return type:

Optional[date]

Raises:

ValueError – If the birthdate string is not in the correct format.
